definition: angry youth/positive term used to describe young Chinese with extreme nationalistic tendencies/see also 糞青|粪青[fen4 qing1]
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province

sentences.english: One of the more sinister-sounding behaviours of China's angry youth online is the 'human flesh search engine'.
sentences.chinese: “人肉搜索”是中国愤青们比较恶毒的手段之一。

sentences.english: This article was on a Fenqing have launched an attack on public opinion.
sentences.chinese: 而这文章一出就遭到愤青们发起了一轮的舆论攻击。
如今他称这些网民为“愤青”和“脑残”。

sentences.english: If I do not impose this sentence someone should say I am anger blueness .
sentences.chinese: 我要是不加上这句话又有人该说我是愤青了。

sentences.english: Angry yung man of many tkink of him as graven image after die.
sentences.chinese: 死后成为众多愤青追捧的偶像。

sentences.english: Rumors is carried by chatters, spread by fools, and accepted by idiots.
sentences.chinese: 流言寄生于灌水，被马甲传播，被愤青认可。

sentences.english: My friend is also slightly tinged with a touch of cynicism and a lot of independence.
sentences.chinese: 我的朋友很独立，也有一点那么“愤青”。

definition: shit youth/used satirically against 憤青|愤青 which shares the same sound/see also 憤青|愤青[fen4 qing1]
public intellectual (sometimes used derogatorily)/abbr. for 公共知識分子|公共知识分子[gong1 gong4 zhi1 shi5 fen4 zi3]
(neologism) person who posts online in support of the Chinese government, but unlike a wumao 五毛[wu3 mao2], is not paid for doing so (abbr. for 自帶乾糧的五毛|自带干粮的五毛[zi4 dai4 gan1 liang2 de5 wu3 mao2])
to revere everything foreign and pander to overseas powers (idiom); blind worship of foreign goods and ideas
young person who adopts an artistic or intellectual style/abbr. for 文藝青年|文艺青年
cannot bear to see/to hate/to dislike/to disapprove
